intro: Neurolaena intermedia, commonly known as the common false dandelion, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into distinctive, elongated seed pods. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and roadsides. Its rapid growth and seed dispersal make it a common weed in many regions.
